item.title: Depression would be cost-effectively decreased in teens by Vitamin D (Iran)
item.description:
Is vitamin D supplementation program in Iranian schools effective in reducing adolescent depressive symptoms? Cost effectiveness study

BMC Public Health . 2023 Jul 20;23(1):1393. doi: 10.1186/s12889-023-16244-z. PDF behind paywall

Seyed Vahid Jasemi 1, Zhale Zandieh 2, Narges Zandieh 1, Mohsen Rezaei Hemami 3, Ali Darvishi 4 5, Zahra Abdollahi 6, Ramin Heshmat 7

Purpose: We aimed to assess the cost-effectiveness of the vitamin D supplementation program in Iranian adolescents reducing adolescent depressive Symptoms.

item.title: Infertile women had less Vitamin D (Baghdad in this case)
item.description:
Prevalence of 25-Hydroxyvitamin D (Vitamin D) Deficiency in a Group of Infertile Women from Baghdad City

Biochemistry Research International Vol 2023 https://doi.org/10.1155/2023/6597730

Muthana Anad Majid ,1 Wafaa Nasser Hassan ,2 a nd Amna Fadhil Ridha 3

Chart of data made by VitaminDWiki

Background. Infertility is a common issue affecting a large number of Iraqi women of reproductive age. The relationship between vitamin D deficiency and infertility has previously drawn the attention of gynecologists, and an increasing number of vitamin D testing has been requested.
